intro: Galium sylvestre var. lapeyrouseanum, commonly known as Lapeyrouse's bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its hairy stems and leaves are adapted to retain moisture, making it well-suited for damp habitats.
